Posts.EditableText: Hello, Quest users. This is my first time using Quest to make a text adventure, and I've stumbled on an annoying problem. Music loops fine when I play the game offline, however online (when uploaded to textadventures.co.uk), music does not loop. On top of that, I get a weird error whenever I start the game that says "Error running script: An item with the same key has already been added." Anyone have any idea why? I might have missed something. Regarding the music issue, I have no idea why it would do that online, especially considering I ticked it to loop, and it loops just fine offline. What could be the issue? The only files I could upload, sadly, was my project file. Doesn't let me add anything else that goes over 256 kbs. Hope this alone helps. Thanks for reading. S0ul EDIT: Here's the online version of the game: http://www.textadventures.co.uk/review/878/ As you can see, music does not loop.
Posts.HTML:
Hello, Quest users.

This is my first time using Quest to make a text adventure, and I've stumbled on an annoying problem. Music loops fine when I play the game offline, however online (when uploaded to textadventures.co.uk), music does not loop. On top of that, I get a weird error whenever I start the game that says "Error running script: An item with the same key has already been added." Anyone have any idea why? I might have missed something.

Regarding the music issue, I have no idea why it would do that online, especially considering I ticked it to loop, and it loops just fine offline. What could be the issue?

The only files I could upload, sadly, was my project file. Doesn't let me add anything else that goes over 256 kbs. Hope this alone helps.

Thanks for reading.

S0ul

EDIT: Here's the online version of the game: http://www.textadventures.co.uk/review/878/ As you can see, music does not loop.
Test_Asylum.aslx

Posts.EditableText: I don't know why music does not loop, but the other error is caused by the status attribute 'health' that you have added to player. Health is a default attribute which is build in. just delete it!
Posts.HTML: I don't know why music does not loop, but the other error is caused by the status attribute 'health' that you have added to player. Health is a default attribute which is build in. just delete it!

Posts.EditableText:
The error is gone. Thanks for that! 

Though, sadly, music still ain't looping. :/
Posts.HTML:
The error is gone. Thanks for that!

Though, sadly, music still ain't looping. :/
